Posts.Content: Hi ClaireyFairy,  I just want to send you a big hug for today. I hope that everything goes well today. Please let the group know how you get on. Since joining this group its so comforting to learn from others that have been through it all before and they give me and i think i can speak for everyone else, so much inspiration. Good luck  Helen x
Posts.Title: Hi Clarey Fairy

Posts.Content: Thanks Crystaljuju, Wise words.  I agree with Wendy this site is probably the best thing that has happened to me in the last few months. Everyone is so helpful and inspiring. At last i feel things are on the up and that i instead of living in a state of panic and despair, i know no matter what time day or night i can reach out and someone will listen. Helen x
Posts.Title: MacDonalds milkshake?

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy,  Sounds like you can carry on with your cravings. So enjoy every minute. Im struggling to curb my cravings of anything sweet and chocolatey. 3 years i lost 4 1/2 stone on slimming world and got down to a size 10-12 which i managed to maintain. However since being diagnosed ive started to gain weight and turning to comfort eating. I maybe panicking but im definately putting weight back on,albeit slowly. But since having my first chemo i crave sugar. I try and tell myself to focus on getting well and that ive lost weight before and i can do it again once i finish trestment. At the moment im still suffering from nausea and just want sugary foods. Im taking the anti sickness meds and it helps. But should i feel so guilty to have a biscuit or cake? Julia,  I dont remember being given a blue book. What foods should i be avoiding?  Hope you can help?  Helen x
